item.title: By: Tanvir
item.dc:creator: Tanvir
item.content:encoded:
Thnx buddy,
It worked great! The current XML RPC API doesn’t allow us to post with a custom post type. [which is kinda #$*@^& stuff. – :P] I searched the net & didnt find any workable solution for me. finally I created a plugin & added my method just to update any post to a given custom_post_type.

/**
* Method to change the Post Type from default to any given Custom Post Type.
*
* @since 3.2.1
* @param array $args Method Parameters – 0 = postId 1 = custom_post_name.
* @return bool
*/
function updatePostType($args) {
if(set_post_type($args[0], $args[1])) {
return true;
} else {
return false;
}
}

I just changed your method name “multiply_two_numbers” with my one üôÇ [“updatePostType”]

item.title: By: L√©on
item.dc:creator: L√©on
item.description:
I used this to add a function which allows you to post comments via mobile. It will need a signed in User, in my case an admin. But you can still post under the name and e-mailaddress the user provides. So the filter: <em>xmlrpc_allow_anonymous_comments</em> remains false and it will nog be open to spammers.
Thanks for this!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2008/11/06/adding-xml-rpc-methods-to-wordpress/#comment-2444">Aaron M.</a>.
If you are looking to trigger an action when a post is published they you want to look at actions and filters. If you just want to edit a post the XML-RPC metaWeblog.editPost method will do that.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Aaron M..

If you are looking to trigger an action when a post is published they you want to look at actions and filters. If you just want to edit a post the XML-RPC metaWeblog.editPost method will do that.
